{{also|fús|fûs|füs|FUs|fuŝ-}}
==Albanian==

===Alternative forms===

* {{l|sq|fut}}

===Etymology===
From {{der|sq|sqj-pro|*sputja}}, from {{der|sq|ine-pro|*pHu-tó-}} (compare {{cog|sh|pítati||to ask}}, {{cog|txb|putk-||to divide, share}}, {{cog|la|puto|putāre|to prune}}).

===Verb===
{{sq-verb|futa|futur}}

# I [[insert]], I [[put]] (something) in
# [[I]] [[fuck]] {{q|vulgar, slang}}
#: '''''Futja''' (karin) morë.''
#:: '''''Fuck it''' man''.

==Maltese==

===Etymology===
Probably from {{bor|mt|scn|fusu}}, from {{der|mt|la|fusus|t=spindle}}; but perhaps merged with {{der|mt|ar|فُؤُوس}}, plural of {{m|ar|فَأْس|lit=axe}}, which is used figuratively for different kinds of protrusions (or is it conceivable that this Arabic use is itself influenced by the Latin?). The plural in {{m|mt|-ien}} at any rate speaks in favour of an early borrowing.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|mt|/fuːs/}}

===Noun===
{{mt-noun|g=m|p=fusien}}

# [[axle]], [[axis]] 

----

==Middle English==

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|enm|fous}}

===Etymology===
From {{der|enm|ang|fūs}}, see below

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|enm|/fuːs/}}

===Adjective===
{{enm-adj}}

# [[ready]], [[eager]], striving forward, [[inclined]] to, [[willing]], [[prompt]]
#: ''Of vr saul to be ai '''fus''' Again þe com, þat es sa crus.'' &mdash; ''Cursor Mundi'', 1400
# [[ardent]], [[zealous]], [[passionate]], [[expectant]], [[brave]], [[noble]]: ready to depart, die; [[dying]]
#: ''Þaa foles feluns þat war '''fuus''' All vmlapped loth huse.'' &mdash; ''Cursor Mundi'', 1400

====Related terms====
* {{l|enm|fusen}} &mdash; to urge on or exhort

====Descendants====
* [[fouse]]

===Adjective===
{{nb-adj-1}}

# [[eager]]

===Noun===
{{nb-noun-m1}}

# the [[first]] one when playing a [[game]]

===References===

==Old English==

===Etymology===
From {{inh|ang|gem-pro|*funsaz||ready, willing}}. Cognate with {{cog|osx|fūs}}, {{cog|goh|funs}}, {{cog|non|fúss}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{ang-IPA|fūs}}

===Noun===
{{ang-noun|n|head=fūs}}

# a hastening, progress <!-- from B-T -->
#: {{quotei|ang|Se þe leófra manna fús feor wlátode.|He who beheld afar the dear men's progress.}}

====Declension====
{{ang-decl-noun-a-n|fūs}}{{attention|ang|Not sure about the declen. of the noun}}

===Adjective===
{{ang-adj|fūs}}

# [[ready]], [[eager]], striving forward, [[inclined]] to, [[willing]], [[prompt]]
#: {{quotei|ang|Se ðe stód '''fús''' on faroþe.|He who stood ready on the beach.}}
#: {{quotei|ang|Hwæðere þær '''fuse''' / feorran cwoman / to þam æðelinge.|Nevertheless the eager ones came from afar to the lord. (The Dream of the Rood)}}
# [[expectant]], [[brave]], [[noble]]: ready to depart, die; [[dying]]

====Declension====
{{ang-adecl|fūs}}

====Derived terms====
* {{l|ang|fūse}}, {{l|ang|fūslīċe||[[readily]], [[gladly]]}}
* {{l|ang|utfus||[[out-eagerː eager to sail]]}}
* {{l|ang|fūslēoþ||death-song, [[dirge]]}}
* {{l|ang|fūslīċ||ready to start: [[excellent]]}}
* {{l|ang|fūsnes||[[quickness]]}}

====Related terms====
* {{l|ang|fȳsan||to send forth, impel, stimulate: drive away, put to flight, banish: (usu. reflex.) hasten, prepare oneself}}
* {{l|ang|fȳsian}}, {{l|ang|fēsian||to drive away}}

====Descendants====
* {{desc|en|fouse}}
